GT.content: transcendental signified or signifier as general equivalent, “transcendental” makes possible every categorial determination, all givens (to be/to have, thing/person)
GT.linkedContent: transcendental signified or signifier as general equivalent, “transcendental” makes possible every categorial determination, all givens (to be/to have, thing/person)

GT.content: Lacan’s “symbolic order” guards gift against dissemination, against itself

PP.content: Hermes, signifier-god, steals (dérobe) and steals away (se dérobe)
PP.linkedContent: Hermes, signifier-god, steals (dérobe) and steals away (se dérobe)

VP.content: the more the signifier is ideal, more it augments potency of repetition of presence, the more it protects, preserves, reserves and capitalizes on sense
VP.linkedContent: the more the signifier is ideal, more it augments potency of repetition of presence, the more it protects, preserves, reserves and capitalizes on sense

FSW.content: via Freud, because there is no exhaustive and absolutely infallible code, the difference btwn signifier & signified is no longer radical [no big Other?]
FSW.linkedContent: via Freud, because there is no exhaustive and absolutely infallible code, the difference btwn signifier & signified is no longer radical [no big Other?]

FSW.content: agreeing w/ Saussure that signifier/signified two sides of same paper, originary writing must still produce space & materiality of sheet itself
FSW.linkedContent: agreeing w/ Saussure that signifier/signified two sides of same paper, originary writing must still produce space & materiality of sheet itself

FSW.content: a psychoanalysis respectful of literary signifier has not yet begun
FSW.linkedContent: a psychoanalysis respectful of literary signifier has not yet begun

PPHS.content: origin, inaugural imaginary limit, myth of transcendental signified, archeology before trace and difference
PPHS.linkedContent: origin, inaugural imaginary limit, myth of transcendental signified, archeology before trace and difference

WM.content: for Pierre Louis, in Plato, metaphor plays role of pedagogical ornament, what matters is signified content, intention of truth [Derrida calls these paradoxical & traditional propositions]
WM.linkedContent: for Pierre Louis, in Plato, metaphor plays role of pedagogical ornament, what matters is signified content, intention of truth [Derrida calls these paradoxical & traditional propositions]

WM.content: by saying every phonic enunciation is a metaphor, Nietzsche makes it seem that every signifier is a metaphor of the signified?
WM.linkedContent: by saying every phonic enunciation is a metaphor, Nietzsche makes it seem that every signifier is a metaphor of the signified?

DS.content: thematism leaves out formal, phonic, graphic “affinities,” ignores play that takes word apart > thematism gathers semes linked by meaning (or signified concept)
DS.linkedContent: thematism leaves out formal, phonic, graphic “affinities,” ignores play that takes word apart > thematism gathers semes linked by meaning (or signified concept)

DS.content: trace, hymen: cut off from depending on any signified
DS.linkedContent: trace, hymen: cut off from depending on any signified

DS.content: hymen not even a signifier or sign [an event?], thus everything that comes from propagation-structure of hymen, i.e. text, is never truly made up of “signs” or “signifiers”
DS.linkedContent: hymen not even a signifier or sign [an event?], thus everything that comes from propagation-structure of hymen, i.e. text, is never truly made up of “signs” or “signifiers”

DS.content: neither castration nor dissemination can become originary, central signified, dissem. represents affirmation of this nonorigin, it entails, relaunches, “inscribes” castration
DS.linkedContent: neither castration nor dissemination can become originary, central signified, dissem. represents affirmation of this nonorigin, it entails, relaunches, “inscribes” castration

P.content: re: art, three ways of truth: 1) word (signifier) 2) concept (signified) 3) thing (referent)
P.linkedContent: re: art, three ways of truth: 1) word (signifier) 2) concept (signified) 3) thing (referent)

P.content: what is beautiful is dissemination, pure cut w/out negativity; negativity is significant; adherence always connotes division, lack, negativity; beauty is not a signifier; the signifier: accounts for everything except beauty > a non-sterilized cut from fecundation: la semence s’erre
P.linkedContent: what is beautiful is dissemination, pure cut w/out negativity; negativity is significant; adherence always connotes division, lack, negativity; beauty is not a signifier; the signifier: accounts for everything except beauty > a non-sterilized cut from fecundation: la semence s’erre

POS.content: signifier/signified as sensible/intelligible or signans/signatum (concept), Saussure does not avoid this common, Medieval, stoical trope
POS.linkedContent: signifier/signified as sensible/intelligible or signans/signatum (concept), Saussure does not avoid this common, Medieval, stoical trope

POS.content: Saussure leaves open potential for “transcendental signified,” which would exceed chain of signs, no longer function as signifier
POS.linkedContent: Saussure leaves open potential for “transcendental signified,” which would exceed chain of signs, no longer function as signifier

POS.content: signifier/signified neither radical nor absolute difference, still it functions, even indispensable w/in certain limits
POS.linkedContent: signifier/signified neither radical nor absolute difference, still it functions, even indispensable w/in certain limits

POS.content: theme of transcendental signified took place w/in idea of pure, unequivocal translatability, where translation practices difference btwn signifier/signified; Derrida proposes, if difference btwn signifier/signified is never pure, calling translation transformation
POS.linkedContent: theme of transcendental signified took place w/in idea of pure, unequivocal translatability, where translation practices difference btwn signifier/signified; Derrida proposes, if difference btwn signifier/signified is never pure, calling translation transformation

POS.content: communication: transmission of identity of signified object from one subject (presupposes subject) to another: A communicates B to C
POS.linkedContent: communication: transmission of identity of signified object from one subject (presupposes subject) to another: A communicates B to C

POS.content: phenomenology’s concept of “meaning” appears wider (i.e. all experiences) than Sausurre’s, but it also claims that signifier is exteriorization (Äusserung) or expression (Ausdruck) of signified
POS.linkedContent: phenomenology’s concept of “meaning” appears wider (i.e. all experiences) than Sausurre’s, but it also claims that signifier is exteriorization (Äusserung) or expression (Ausdruck) of signified

POS.content: Husserl’s Bedeutung becomes pure signified, wouldn’t be in differential tissue of gram, trace, spacing
POS.linkedContent: Husserl’s Bedeutung becomes pure signified, wouldn’t be in differential tissue of gram, trace, spacing

POS.content: signifier exceeding signified still maintains logocentrism (stuck in phase of overturning hierarchy, not beyond opposition)
POS.linkedContent: signifier exceeding signified still maintains logocentrism (stuck in phase of overturning hierarchy, not beyond opposition)

POS.content: dissemination puts at stake (play) castration’s position as transcendental signifier/signified (phallus, transcendental signifier, as correlate to primary signified, mother’s desire)
POS.linkedContent: dissemination puts at stake (play) castration’s position as transcendental signifier/signified (phallus, transcendental signifier, as correlate to primary signified, mother’s desire)

ATIA.content: for Lacan, animal’s inability to be subject to “signifier,” inability to be evil (deceit)
ATIA.linkedContent: for Lacan, animal’s inability to be subject to “signifier,” inability to be evil (deceit)

ATIA.content: Derrida substituted trace for signifier to ensure that erasure and inscription could be included in the same structure
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida substituted trace for signifier to ensure that erasure and inscription could be included in the same structure

PS.content: acc. Artaud, letter is always stolen, because always open, never leads from subject to subject; autonomy of signifier as letter’s historicity, my vouloir-dire is submissive
PS.linkedContent: acc. Artaud, letter is always stolen, because always open, never leads from subject to subject; autonomy of signifier as letter’s historicity, my vouloir-dire is submissive

O.content: writing situates every signified as a differential trace
“transcendental signified” arrests writing [in structure of double mark this arrest can no longer occur, writing as possibility of living on, arrêt de mort]
O.linkedContent: “transcendental signified” arrests writing [in structure of double mark this arrest can no longer occur, writing as possibility of living on, arrêt de mort]

O.content: re: writing, Hegel does not think exteriority, repetitive autonomy of remainder > writing becomes pro-gramme, pre-scription, pre-text, the simple empirical husk (déchet) of concept
O.linkedContent: re: writing, Hegel does not think exteriority, repetitive autonomy of remainder > writing becomes pro-gramme, pre-scription, pre-text, the simple empirical husk (déchet) of concept

O.content: for Derrida, this husk is coextensive w/ whole life of discourse
O.linkedContent: for Derrida, this husk is coextensive w/ whole life of discourse

O.content: signifier sublated in process of meaning (the signified) > Hegel’s dialectic
O.linkedContent: signifier sublated in process of meaning (the signified) > Hegel’s dialectic

TR.content: “free signifier” ribbon like Lacan’s purloined letter: content is not important
[re: Poe, Lacan] purloined letter not a free/undetermined signifier, at the very least signifies perjury, betrayal of a sworn faith
TR.linkedContent: [re: Poe, Lacan] purloined letter not a free/undetermined signifier, at the very least signifies perjury, betrayal of a sworn faith

WAP.content: Derrida’s work tackled (s’attaquait) the subordination of a signifying body to a transcendental signified or signifier, beyond an internal self-critique that maintains philosophy’s proper
WAP.linkedContent: Derrida’s work tackled (s’attaquait) the subordination of a signifying body to a transcendental signified or signifier, beyond an internal self-critique that maintains philosophy’s proper

WAP.content: as a didactic technique, teaching becomes organon of repetition, teaching as history of the sign > teaching body lives from belief in transcendental signified, which comes back to life, more and better, w/ authority of transcendental phallus (signifier of signifiers)
WAP.linkedContent: as a didactic technique, teaching becomes organon of repetition, teaching as history of the sign > teaching body lives from belief in transcendental signified, which comes back to life, more and better, w/ authority of transcendental phallus (signifier of signifiers)

EJQB.content: metaphor (animality of letter): primary & infinite equivocality of signifier as life > psychic subversion of inert literality (i.e. nature) or of speech returned to nature
EJQB.linkedContent: metaphor (animality of letter): primary & infinite equivocality of signifier as life > psychic subversion of inert literality (i.e. nature) or of speech returned to nature

LI.content: remainder, not that of signifier any more than that of signified, of the “token,” of “type,” of form or content
LI.linkedContent: remainder, not that of signifier any more than that of signified, of the “token,” of “type,” of form or content

LI.content: unity of signifying form due to its iterability, possibility of being repeated in absence of a determinate signified
LI.linkedContent: unity of signifying form due to its iterability, possibility of being repeated in absence of a determinate signified

LI.content: Derrida suspicious of sign, of opposition signifier/signified

EU.content: if an utterance is bound to a language that irreducibly forms signifying fabric of its presentation & its signified theme—translation would obliterate very heart of the “signified,” no longer simply altering ratio btwn signifier/signified
EU.linkedContent: if an utterance is bound to a language that irreducibly forms signifying fabric of its presentation & its signified theme—translation would obliterate very heart of the “signified,” no longer simply altering ratio btwn signifier/signified

FV.content: Lacan translates Wiederholungszwang as “repetition automatism,” the pre-eminence of signifier over signified > consequence: “literary” text does w/out reference to author [Derrida implies that Lacan takes, at times, his distrust of psychobiography too far in other direction: formalist neutralization of effects of signature]
FV.linkedContent: Lacan translates Wiederholungszwang as “repetition automatism,” the pre-eminence of signifier over signified > consequence: “literary” text does w/out reference to author [Derrida implies that Lacan takes, at times, his distrust of psychobiography too far in other direction: formalist neutralization of effects of signature]

FV.content: for Lacan, signifier’s materiality (not empirical) due to certain indivisibility and locality (found where it isn’t) > indivisibility & locality are indissociable—rivet us (nous river), make us arrive at that which properly links singular to signature: guarantee of unity of signifier
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, signifier’s materiality (not empirical) due to certain indivisibility and locality (found where it isn’t) > indivisibility & locality are indissociable—rivet us (nous river), make us arrive at that which properly links singular to signature: guarantee of unity of signifier

FV.content: Lacan analyzes displacement of signifier as signified, as recounted object of a short story
FV.linkedContent: Lacan analyzes displacement of signifier as signified, as recounted object of a short story

FV.content: Lacan is missing an elaboration of frame, signature, parergon > this lack permits scene of signifier to be reconstructed into a signified (inevitable process in logic of sign)
FV.linkedContent: Lacan is missing an elaboration of frame, signature, parergon > this lack permits scene of signifier to be reconstructed into a signified (inevitable process in logic of sign)

FV.content: Lacan’s exclusion of 4th, exclusion of scene of writing, of 3rd + or – 1: a demand for truth > must take account of remainder in operation of writing, not just narrated content (signifier, the written, letter)
FV.linkedContent: Lacan’s exclusion of 4th, exclusion of scene of writing, of 3rd + or – 1: a demand for truth > must take account of remainder in operation of writing, not just narrated content (signifier, the written, letter)

FV.content: Derrida on Lacan: circulation, acquitting of a debt, a proper place [not naive, empirical topology], detour from [woman’s] hole to itself permits signified to return to its origin—indivisible locality, signifier must never be lost, divided, fragmented
FV.linkedContent: Derrida on Lacan: circulation, acquitting of a debt, a proper place [not naive, empirical topology], detour from [woman’s] hole to itself permits signified to return to its origin—indivisible locality, signifier must never be lost, divided, fragmented

FV.content: circular itinerary, Dupin & analyst find letter where they expect it: Queen wants letter-fetish brought back to her, exchanges one fetish for another w/out spending—because there’s equivalence here (assurance of return): circle of restricted economy, stricture of the ring
FV.linkedContent: circular itinerary, Dupin & analyst find letter where they expect it: Queen wants letter-fetish brought back to her, exchanges one fetish for another w/out spending—because there’s equivalence here (assurance of return): circle of restricted economy, stricture of the ring

FV.content: castration-truth is that which contracts itself (stricture of the ring): brings signifier, fetish, phallus, letter back into their oikos, familiar dwelling, proper place
FV.linkedContent: castration-truth is that which contracts itself (stricture of the ring): brings signifier, fetish, phallus, letter back into their oikos, familiar dwelling, proper place

FV.content: dissemination threatens law of signifier & castration as contract of truth, dissemination entame unity of signifier, i.e. the phallus
FV.linkedContent: dissemination threatens law of signifier & castration as contract of truth, dissemination entame unity of signifier, i.e. the phallus

FV.content: for Bonaparte, gold = penis > for Lacan, money = signifier “most destructive” of signification
FV.linkedContent: for Bonaparte, gold = penis > for Lacan, money = signifier “most destructive” of signification

FV.content: for signifier to be kept (pour que le signifiant se garde) in its letter—no partition (if divisible, always can be lost en route) > materiality—indivisibility—idealization—point de capiton (staples signifier to signified) [?]: Lacan determines letter (no matter what he says) at point of its meaning (ideality): letter escapes partition, movement [no wonder he calls this “materiality” “odd”]
FV.linkedContent: for signifier to be kept (pour que le signifiant se garde) in its letter—no partition (if divisible, always can be lost en route) > materiality—indivisibility—idealization—point de capiton (staples signifier to signified) [?]: Lacan determines letter (no matter what he says) at point of its meaning (ideality): letter escapes partition, movement [no wonder he calls this “materiality” “odd”]

FV.content: systemic & historical link btwn idealization, relève (Aufhebung), and the voice > Lacan’s elevation of signifier
FV.linkedContent: systemic & historical link btwn idealization, relève (Aufhebung), and the voice > Lacan’s elevation of signifier

FV.content: Lacan: “the phallus is the signifier of this Aufhebung itself, which it inaugurates (initiates) by its disappearance”
FV.linkedContent: Lacan: “the phallus is the signifier of this Aufhebung itself, which it inaugurates (initiates) by its disappearance”

FV.content: Lacan reversed Hegel: not ideal signified but ideal signifier
